us-core-pulse-oximetry.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-pulse-oximetry.description: Defines constraints on the Observation resource to represent inspired O2 by pulse oximetry and inspired oxygen concentration observations with a standard LOINC codes and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.

us-core-head-circumference.name: USCoreHeadCircumferenceProfile

us-core-head-circumference.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-head-circumference.description: Defines constraints on Observation to represent head circumference observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.

us-core-race.name: USCoreRaceExtension
us-core-race.title: US Core Race Extension
us-core-race.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-race.description:
Concepts classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality.  The race codes used to represent these concepts are based upon the [CDC Race and Ethnicity Code Set Version 1.0](http://www.cdc.gov/phin/resources/vocabulary/index.html) which includes over 900 concepts for representing race and ethnicity of which 921 reference race.  The race concepts are grouped by and pre-mapped to the 5 OMB race categories:

 - American Indian or Alaska Native
 - Asian
 - Black or African American
 - Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
 - White.

us-core-medicationrequest.title: US Core MedicationRequest Profile
us-core-medicationrequest.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-medicationrequest.description: Defines constraints and extensions on the MedicationRequest resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve prescription information.

us-core-condition.name: USCoreCondition

us-core-condition.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-condition.description: Defines constraints and extensions on the Condition resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve problems and health concerns information.

us-core-birthsex.name: USCoreBirthSexExtension
us-core-birthsex.title: US Core Birth Sex Extension
us-core-birthsex.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-birthsex.description: A code classifying the person's sex assigned at birth  as specified by the [Office of the National Coordinator for Health IT (ONC)](https://www.healthit.gov/newsroom/about-onc). This extension aligns with the C-CDA Birth Sex Observation (LOINC 76689-9).

us-core-encounter.name: USCoreEncounterProfile

us-core-encounter.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-encounter.description: The Encounter referenced in the US Core profiles.

us-core-observation-social-history-asses.name: USCoreObservationSocialHistoryAssessment
us-core-observation-social-history-asses.title: US Core Social History Assessment Observation Profile
us-core-observation-social-history-asses.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-observation-social-history-asses.description: Profile for simple observations made by an individual about a patient's social history status such as education, food insecurity, etc.  These observation involve assessment by a provider, payer, etc. as opposed to being derived only from screening surveys which should be represented using the [US Core Screening Response Observation Profile](StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-screening-response.html)

us-core-body-height.description: Defines constraints on Observation to represent body height observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.

us-core-procedure.description: Defines constraints and extensions on the Procedure resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve patient's procedure information. This profile can be used to record a service or intervention that is or was performed on or for a patient.

us-core-medication.title: US Core Medication Profile
us-core-medication.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-medication.description: Defines constraints and extensions on the Medication resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve patient retrieving patient's medication information.

us-core-blood-pressure.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-blood-pressure.description: Defines constraints on Observation to represent diastolic and systolic blood pressure observations with standard LOINC codes and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.

us-core-careplan.description: Defines constraints and extensions on the CarePlan resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve a patient's Care Plan.

us-core-goal.name: USCoreGoalProfile
us-core-goal.title: US Core Goal Profile
us-core-goal.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-goal.description: Defines constraints and extensions on the Goal resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve a patient's goal(s).

us-core-ethnicity.name: USCoreEthnicityExtension
us-core-ethnicity.title: US Core Ethnicity Extension
us-core-ethnicity.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-ethnicity.description: Concepts classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality.  The ethnicity codes used to represent these concepts are based upon the [CDC ethnicity and Ethnicity Code Set Version 1.0](http://www.cdc.gov/phin/resources/vocabulary/index.html) which includes over 900 concepts for representing race and ethnicity of which 43 reference ethnicity.  The ethnicity concepts are grouped by and pre-mapped to the 2 OMB ethnicity categories: - Hispanic or Latino - Not Hispanic or Latino.

us-core-location.title: US Core Location Profile
us-core-location.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-location.description: Defines basic constraints and extensions on the Location resource for use with other US Core resources

us-core-diagnosticreport-lab.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-diagnosticreport-lab.description: Defines constraints and extensions on the DiagnosticReport resource  for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve diagnostic reports associated with laboratory results for a patient

us-core-implantable-device.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-implantable-device.description: Defines constraints and extensions on the Device resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve a patient's implantable device(s).

us-core-observation-imaging.name: USCoreImagingResultObservationProfile
us-core-observation-imaging.title: US Core Imaging Result Observation Profile
us-core-observation-imaging.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-observation-imaging.description: Defines constraints and extensions on the Observation resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve structured and unstructured (narrative) components of imaging test results. These observations include reasons, findings, and impressions.

us-core-observation-clinical-test.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-observation-clinical-test.description: Defines constraints and extensions on the Observation resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve clinical test results

us-core-allergyintolerance.name: USCoreAllergyIntolerance

us-core-allergyintolerance.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-allergyintolerance.description: Defines constraints and extensions on the AllergyIntolerance resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve allergy information.

us-core-observation-screening-response.name: USCoreObservationScreeningResponse
us-core-observation-screening-response.title: US Core Screening Response Observation Profile
us-core-observation-screening-response.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-observation-screening-response.description: Profile for observations that represent question and answer pairs from from surveys/questionnaires such as Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) screening instruments.

pediatric-bmi-for-age.name: USCorePediatricBMIforAgeObservationProfile
pediatric-bmi-for-age.title: US Core Pediatric BMI for Age Observation Profile
pediatric-bmi-for-age.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
pediatric-bmi-for-age.description: Defines constraints on Observation to represent to represent BMI percentile per age and sex for youth 2-20 observations in FHIR using a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.

head-occipital-frontal-circumference-per.name: USCorePediatricHeadOccipitalFrontalCircumferencePercentileProfile
head-occipital-frontal-circumference-per.title: US Core Pediatric Head Occipital-frontal Circumference Percentile Profile
head-occipital-frontal-circumference-per.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
head-occipital-frontal-circumference-per.description: Defines constraints on the Observation resource to represent head occipital-frontal circumference percentile for patients from birth to 36 months of age in FHIR using a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.

us-core-body-weight.name: USCoreBodyWeightProfile
us-core-body-weight.title: US Core Body Weight Profile
us-core-body-weight.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-body-weight.description: Defines constraints on Observation to represent body weight observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure. This profile is derived from the US Core Vital Signs Profile.

us-core-vital-signs.name: USCoreVitalSignsProfile
us-core-vital-signs.title: US Core Vital Signs Profile
us-core-vital-signs.copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License
us-core-vital-signs.description: Defines constraints on the Observation resource to represent vital signs observations.  This profile is used as the base definition for the other US Core Vital Signs Profiles and based on the FHIR VitalSigns Profile.
